description: Greenland is an initiative that emerged from a collaboration of 36 banana farms in Apartado, Colombia, aimed at fostering social and environmental sustainability in the region. Established over 30 years ago, the foundation operates on four key pillars: health, housing, sports, and education, focusing on improving the living conditions and well-being of its workers and their families. The foundation not only provides housing assistance and health care but also engages in community investment by creating infrastructure and supporting local sports programs. Additionally, it addresses food security by utilizing surplus bananas to produce banana flour, which is distributed to underprivileged areas.
name: Greenland
